title: Spooky good times on the big screen at area theaters this week
text:

Tim Curry reclines in a scene from "The Rocky Horror Picture Show'' 
A creepy scene from "Nosferatu'' 
Who you gonna call for some Halloween fun on the big screen? 
“Ghostbusters,’’ the 1984 film about a group of eccentric paraphsychologists who save the world from evil spirits, is just one of several movie nods to the season coming up in this week. 
So if you’re a film buff who loves Halloween, listen up. 
On Saturday, Hershey Theatre , 15 E. Caracas Ave., Hershey, will screen two seasonal favorites: “Ghostbusters,’’ starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis, will be shown at 7 p.m. 
And at 11:59 p.m. comes the cult classic, “The Rocky Horror Picture Show.’’ 
The film, starring Tim Curry, Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick, Richard O’Brien, and Meat Loaf, has inspired a following among faithful fans who dress up like their favorite characters, sing along to the songs and play with props dictated by the movie. 
The Hershey Theatre’s midnight showing allows all of that, but outside props are prohibited. Guests can buy a prop bag there for $6. 
Admission to each film is $8. Call 717-534-3405 or visit hersheytheatre.com . 
Those looking for a more creepy experience might want to take in the Ware Center’ s showing of the 1922 silent film “Nosferatu.’’ 
Accompanied by a live original score by Not So Silent Cinema, the film will be screened Monday, Oct. 26, at 7 p.m. at the center, 42 N. Prince St. 
The film is based on the Bram Stoker novel, “Dracula,’’ but changes names and details. 
Stoker’s widow sued the production company over the film saying that it did not have rights to the book. She won and the company went out of business and all copies of the film were ordered to be destroyed. 
But that, as we know now, was never completed and the movie stands as one of the masterpieces in early horror. 
Tickets are $10. Call 717-871-7600 or visit artsmu.com . Tags
